hillbillies.part3.programs

Interface ITaskFactory<E,S,T>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - Your class for representing an expression.
    S - Your class for representing a statement.
    T - Your class for representing a task (should be Task).
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TaskFactory

    public interface ITaskFactory<E,S,T>
    A task factory is used by the parser (TaskParser) to construct an in-memory representation of your program. For example, when reading the task description 
     name: "test"
 priority: 1
 activities: moveTo here;
    the parser will create a Task object by (conceptually) executing the following code: 
     factory.createTask("test", 1, factory.createMoveTo(factory.createHerePosition()))
    on the returned factory object.

    For testing, you may use the methods from TaskParser yourself, as demonstrated in the partial test file Part3TestPartial.

    You should declare your class as follows:

     public class TaskFactory implements ITaskFactory<MyExpression, MyStatement, Task>
    where MyExpression and MyStatement are your classes for representing expressions and statements, respectively.

    The SourceLocation object in the methods defined by this factory refers to the location (line and column) in the text file where the statement or expression begins.

    • Method Detail

      • createTasks

        java.util.List<T> createTasks(java.lang.String name,
                              int priority,
                              S activity,
                              java.util.List<int[]> selectedCubes)
        Create a list of tasks from the given arguments.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the task
        priority - The initial priority of the task
        activity - The activity of the task. Most likely this is a sequence statement.
        selectedCubes - A list of cube coordinates (each represented as an array {x, y, z}) that were selected by the player in the GUI.
        Returns:
        A list of new task instances. One task instance should be created for each selectedCube coordinate. If selectedCubes is empty and the 'selected' expression does not occur in the activity, a list with exactly one Task instance should be returned.

      • createAssignment

        S createAssignment(java.lang.String variableName,
                   E value,
                   SourceLocation sourceLocation)
        Create a statement that represents the assignment of a variable.
        Parameters:
        variableName - The name of the assigned variable
        value - An expression that evaluates to the assigned value

        S createWhile(E condition,
              S body,
              SourceLocation sourceLocation)
        Create a statement that represents a while loop.
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition of the while loop
        body - The body of the loop (most likely this is a sequence statement).

      • createIf

        S createIf(E condition,
           S ifBody,
           S elseBody,
           SourceLocation sourceLocation)
        Create an if-then-else statement.
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition of the if statement
        ifBody - * The body of the if-part, which must be executed when the condition evaluates to true
        elseBody - The body of the else-part, which must be executed when the condition evaluates to false. Can be null if no else clause is specified.

      • createAnd

        E createAnd(E left,
            E right,
            SourceLocation sourceLocation)
        Create an expression that evaluates to true when both the left and right expression evaluate to true; false otherwise.
        Note:
        short-circuit: the right expression does not need to be evaluated when the left expression evaluates to false.

      • createOr

        E createOr(E left,
           E right,
           SourceLocation sourceLocation)
        Create an expression that evaluates to false only when the left and right expression evaluate to false; true otherwise.
        Note:
        short-circuit: the right expression does not need to be evaluated when the left expression evaluates to true.

      • createHerePosition

      • createLogPosition

        E createLogPosition(SourceLocation sourceLocation)
        Create an expression that evaluates to the position of a log.
        Note:
        for groups of two students, this needs to be the log closest to the unit that is executing the task.

      • createBoulderPosition

        E createBoulderPosition(SourceLocation sourceLocation)
        Create an expression that evaluates to the position of a boulder.

        for groups of two students, this needs to be the boulder closest to the unit that is executing the task.
